list_definition.definition: the supervisor or leader of a group, especially of workmen or a jury

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The foreman here is in charge of twenty workmen.

list_ex_of_english: Traders were advised by cartage foremen, carters, motor drivers and the company's commercial representatives.
The census category from which the 51 percent figure was calculated included foremen along with wage workers.
Workers remain fearful of arbitrary dismissals and female workers in particular are treated poorly by certain foremen.
Operations management might include department managers, warehouse foremen and the head clerks.
There are three foremen engaged on wagon repair work, but no charge hands.
Migrants with longer experience and better language skills helped newcomers in their dealings with foremen, employers, doctors and the police.
The employers, the shop-floor workers and the foremen understood the arrangement.
As a consequence, it is difficult for the leader to provide an incentive for the foremen.
